ElementDescription: The NDAR Global Unique Identifier (GUID) for research subject
Subject ID how it's defined in lab/project
Date on which the interview/genetic test/sampling/imaging/biospecimen was completed. MM/DD/YYYY
Age in months at the time of the interview/test/sampling/imaging.
Notes: Age is rounded to chronological month. If the research participant is 15-days-old at time of interview, the appropriate value would be 0 months. If the participant is 16-days-old, the value would be 1 month.
M = Male; F = Female; O=Other; NR = Not reported

ElementDescription: Do you (study participant) believe you are depressed? Repeat question if necessary, but do not describe depression
Do you (caregiver) believe your mother/father/loved one (study participant) is depressed? Repeat question if necessary, but do not describe depression
Has your mother/father/loved one (study participant) ever been treated for depression by a professional before? Repeat question if necessary, but do not describe depression
Do you (caregiver) believe that YOU are depressed? Repeat question if necessary, but do not describe depression

Notes: System variable: unique code for each type of visit -use to merge files
